quizzes.title: Android Basics
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of Android development fundamentals

questions.explanation: Android is a mobile operating system developed by Google, based on the Linux kernel.

questions.questionText: What is an Activity in Android?
options: A screen in an Android app
questions.explanation: An Activity is a single screen in an Android app that users can interact with.

questions.questionText: What is a Layout in Android?
options: A structure that defines the UI for an Activity
questions.explanation: A Layout defines the structure and appearance of the UI for an Activity in Android.

options: A configuration file that describes the app
questions.explanation: The Android Manifest is a configuration file that describes essential information about the app to the Android system.

questions.questionText: What is a Fragment in Android?
questions.explanation: A Fragment is a reusable UI component that represents a portion of a user interface in an Activity.

questions.questionText: What is an Intent in Android?
options: A messaging object for requesting actions from other components
questions.explanation: An Intent is a messaging object that can be used to request an action from another app component.

questions.questionText: What is a Service in Android?
options: A component that runs in the background without a UI
questions.explanation: A Service is a component that runs in the background to perform long-running operations without a user interface.

questions.questionText: What is a BroadcastReceiver in Android?
options: A component that responds to system-wide broadcast announcements
questions.explanation: A BroadcastReceiver is a component that responds to system-wide broadcast announcements.

questions.questionText: What is a ContentProvider in Android?
options: A component that manages access to a structured set of data
questions.explanation: A ContentProvider manages access to a structured set of data and provides a mechanism for data sharing between applications.

questions.questionText: What is a RecyclerView in Android?
options: A flexible view for displaying a large dataset
questions.explanation: RecyclerView is a flexible view for displaying a large dataset that can be scrolled efficiently.

questions.questionText: What is a ViewGroup in Android?
options: A container that holds and organizes multiple views
questions.explanation: ViewGroup is a container that holds and organizes multiple views, managing their layout and appearance.

questions.questionText: What is a Context in Android?
options: An interface to global information about an application environment
questions.explanation: Context is an interface to global information about an application environment, providing access to resources and system services.

questions.questionText: What is a Handler in Android?
options: A class that allows you to send and process messages and runnable objects
questions.explanation: Handler is a class that allows you to send and process messages and runnable objects associated with a thread's message queue.

questions.questionText: What is a Looper in Android?
options: A class that runs a message loop for a thread
questions.explanation: Looper is a class that runs a message loop for a thread, processing messages from a message queue.

questions.questionText: What is a Toast in Android?
options: A view that shows a brief message to the user
questions.explanation: Toast is a view that shows a brief message to the user, appearing for a short duration and then disappearing.

options: A component that manages UI-related data
questions.explanation: ViewModel is a component that manages UI-related data and survives configuration changes.
LiveData is an observable data holder that is lifecycle-aware and can be observed by UI components.
Room is a persistence library that provides an abstraction layer over SQLite for local data storage.
Retrofit is a type-safe HTTP client for Android that makes it easy to consume RESTful web services.
Coroutines is a library that provides a way to write asynchronous code in a sequential manner.

options: A dependency injection library built on top of Dagger
questions.explanation: Dagger Hilt is a dependency injection library built on top of Dagger that simplifies dependency injection in Android apps.

options: A library for loading and displaying large datasets
questions.explanation: Paging 3 is a library that helps you load and display large datasets efficiently.

options: A data storage solution that replaces SharedPreferences
questions.explanation: DataStore is a data storage solution that replaces SharedPreferences, providing a more robust way to store key-value pairs.

options: A framework for handling navigation between destinations
questions.explanation: Navigation Component is a framework that helps implement navigation between destinations in an app.

options: A library for managing background tasks
questions.explanation: WorkManager is a library that helps manage background tasks that need to run even if the app is closed.

options: A dependency injection library built on top of Dagger
questions.explanation: Hilt is a dependency injection library built on top of Dagger that simplifies dependency injection in Android apps.

options: A framework for handling navigation between destinations
questions.explanation: Navigation Component is a framework that helps implement navigation between destinations in an app.

options: A data storage solution that replaces SharedPreferences
questions.explanation: DataStore is a data storage solution that replaces SharedPreferences, providing a more robust way to store key-value pairs.
CameraX is a library that helps implement camera functionality in Android apps with less boilerplate code.

options: A publishing format for Android apps
questions.explanation: App Bundle is a publishing format that allows Google Play to generate optimized APKs for different device configurations.

options: A way to split an app into smaller modules
questions.explanation: Dynamic Feature Modules allow you to split your app into smaller modules that can be downloaded on demand.

options: A way to associate your app with a website
questions.explanation: Android App Links allow you to associate your app with a website, enabling deep linking and better user experience.

options: A publishing format that reduces app size
questions.explanation: Android App Bundle is a publishing format that helps reduce app size by generating optimized APKs for different device configurations.

options: A set of libraries, tools, and architectural guidance
questions.explanation: Android Jetpack is a set of libraries, tools, and architectural guidance to help developers build high-quality apps.

options: A collection of libraries that help design robust, testable, and maintainable apps
questions.explanation: Android Architecture Components are a collection of libraries that help design robust, testable, and maintainable apps.

quizzes.title: Android Advanced
quizzes.description: Advanced Android development concepts and best practices

questions.explanation: Jetpack Compose is a modern UI toolkit for building native Android UI using Kotlin.
Hilt is a dependency injection library for Android that reduces boilerplate code.
WorkManager is a library that helps manage background tasks that need to run even if the app is closed.
Navigation Component is a framework that helps implement navigation between destinations in an app.
DataStore is a data storage solution that provides a more robust way to store key-value pairs and typed objects.
CameraX is a library that helps implement camera functionality in Android apps with less boilerplate code.

options: A publishing format for Android apps
questions.explanation: App Bundle is a publishing format that allows Google Play to generate optimized APKs for different device configurations.

options: A way to split an app into smaller modules
questions.explanation: Dynamic Feature Modules allow you to split your app into smaller modules that can be downloaded on demand.

options: A way to associate your app with a website
questions.explanation: Android App Links allow you to associate your app with a website, enabling deep linking and better user experience.

options: A publishing format that reduces app size
questions.explanation: Android App Bundle is a publishing format that helps reduce app size by generating optimized APKs for different device configurations.

options: A tool for analyzing app performance
questions.explanation: Android Performance Profiler is a tool that helps analyze app performance, including CPU, memory, network, and battery usage.

options: A tool for analyzing memory usage
questions.explanation: Android Memory Profiler is a tool that helps identify memory leaks and memory churn in your app.

options: A tool for analyzing CPU usage
questions.explanation: Android CPU Profiler is a tool that helps analyze CPU usage and identify performance bottlenecks.

options: A tool for analyzing network usage
questions.explanation: Android Network Profiler is a tool that helps analyze network usage and identify network-related issues.

options: A tool for analyzing battery usage
questions.explanation: Android Battery Profiler is a tool that helps analyze battery usage and identify battery-draining issues.

options: A tool for inspecting and debugging layouts
questions.explanation: Android Layout Inspector is a tool that helps inspect and debug layouts in real-time.

options: A tool for analyzing APK contents
questions.explanation: Android APK Analyzer is a tool that helps analyze APK contents and identify size issues.

options: A feature for delivering app features on demand
questions.explanation: Android Dynamic Delivery is a feature that allows delivering app features on demand, reducing initial app size.

questions.questionText: What is Android Play Core Library?
options: A library for implementing Play Store features
questions.explanation: Android Play Core Library is a library that helps implement Play Store features like in-app updates and dynamic delivery.

options: A feature for deep linking and app indexing
questions.explanation: Android App Links is a feature that allows your app to handle web links and appear in Google Search results.

options: A feature for running apps without installation
questions.explanation: Android Instant Apps allows users to run apps without installation, providing a seamless experience.

options: A feature for securing app distribution
questions.explanation: Android App Signing is a feature that helps secure app distribution by managing app signing keys.

options: A platform for managing app distribution
questions.explanation: Android Play Console is a platform for managing app distribution, analytics, and user feedback.

options: A library for implementing in-app purchases
questions.explanation: Android Play Billing is a library that helps implement in-app purchases and subscriptions.

questions.questionText: What is Android Play Games Services?
options: A service for implementing game features
questions.explanation: Android Play Games Services is a service that helps implement game features like achievements and leaderboards.
